result.execSummary:
The defendant Reese E Bressette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Amended 5-11-2017:  Term of probation amended to 2 years.
Consecutive to: 16CF64
Concurrent w/16CF71, 16CF142, 16CF51 and 16CM11

miscConds.notes: Fine and court costs totaling $475.60.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
Cognitive behavior therapy and any other counseling as recommended by agent.

No contact with Ian M., Robert H., John A., Donald J. and Frederick P.      Not to possess or consume any alcohol or drugs, except for medications as prescribed by a physician and taken only as prescribed.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.  Subject to random UAs.     Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
